intro: Dasystephana romanzovii, commonly known as the Romanzov’s star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often growing in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
